intro: Lunathyrium acutum var. liubaense, commonly known as the Liubaense Moonflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its large, bell-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral characteristics, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
